snippet: A Human Rights Watch report, which investigated violence last winter in the western oil town of Zhanaozen, says Kazakhstan and three oil companies repressed workers.
abstract: Human Rights Watch report accuses three oil companies and the government of Kazakhstan of abusing and repressing workers in the country's oil fields; nongovernmental group based in New York monitors abuses around the world, and its report is the most comprehensive examination yet of events last winter in the oil town of Zhanaozen, where 12 people were killed when the police fired on striking workers.
lead_paragraph: A Human Rights Watch report, which investigated violence last winter in the western oil town of Zhanaozen, says Kazakhstan and three oil companies repressed workers.

headline.seo: Human Rights Watch Report Says Kazakhstan Abuses Oil Workers
headline.main: Kazakhstan Is Accused of Abusing Oil Workers
headline.print_headline: Kazakhstan Is Accused Of Abusing Oil Workers

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
